reporting-org.narrative: Ministerstvo zahraničných vecí a európskych záležitostí SR
Ministry of Foreign and European Affairs of the Slovak Republic

title.narrative: OECD DAC Peer Review ODA SR 2018 - participants from Moldova
OECD DAC Peer Review ODA SR 2018 - účastníci z Moldavska

description.narrative:
During 2018, the process of preparing a new Strategy for the next five years (2019-2023) was launched. One of the key aspects of this process was involvement of Moldovan development partners as much as possible. This activity was therefore aimed at ensuring the participation of representatives of two Moldovan organizations at the OECD DAC Peer Review ODA SR 2018.

In both cases these are organizations that have long-term experience with the implementation of the SlovakAid projects and their participation in the Peer Review helped to obtain valuable information for the definition of a new development cooperation strategy with Moldova as well as knowledge relevant for the practical implementation of the strategy.

The medium-term strategy of development cooperation of the Slovak Republic for the period 2014-2018 specifies the territorial development strategy in the program countries at territorial level. The Development Cooperation Strategy of the Slovak Republic with MR for the years 2014-2018 defines as priorities: "1. Good governance "and" 2. Water and sanitation "(the concept of sanitation also includes waste management within the meaning of the OECD DAC classification).

EPPO (Environmental Pollution Prevention Office) has been implementing SlovakAid projects in partnership with the Slovak Environmental Agency (SAE) since 2011. These are projects aimed at creating a legislative and institutional waste management system with a specific focus on waste from electrical equipment. In this respect, EPPO and SAEs address both priorities of the current strategy (Good Governance and Water and Sanitation).

ADRA Moldova has been implementing SlovakAid projects in co-operation with ADRA Slovakia since 2009. These are projects in the field of improving drinking water availability and sewerage for rural areas, focusing on educational institutions (drinking water and wastewater treatment in schools and kindergartens).

V priebehu roka 2018 bol spustený proces prípravy novej stratégie na nasledujúcich päť rokov (2019-2023). Jedným z kľúčových aspektov tohto procesu bolo zapojenie moldavských rozvojových partnerov v čo najvyššej možnej miere. Predkladaná aktivita bola z tohto dôvodu zameraná na zabezpečenie účasti predstaviteľov dvoch moldavských organizácií na OECD DAC Peer Review ODA SR. V oboch prípadoch sa jedná o organizácie, ktoré majú s implementáciou projektov SlovakAid dlhodobé skúsenosti a ich účasť na Peer Review pomôže získať cenné informácie pre potreby definovania novej stratégie rozvojovej spolupráce s Moldavskom, ako aj poznatkov dôležitých pre praktickú implementáciu stratégie.

Strednodobú stratégiu rozvojovej spolupráce SR na roky 2014-2018 konkretizujú na teritoriálnej úrovni stratégie rozvojovej pomoci v jednotlivých programových krajinách. Stratégia rozvojovej spolupráce SR s MR pre roky 2014-2018 definuje ako priority: „1. Dobrá správa vecí verejných“ a „2. Voda a sanitácia“ (pričom pojem sanitácia zahŕňa v zmysle klasifikácie OECD DAC aj odpadové hospodárstvo).

EPPO (Environmental Pollution Prevention Office) realizuje projekty SlovakAid v partnerstve so Slovenskou agentúrou životného prostredia (SAŽP) už od roku 2011. Ide o projekty zamerané na vytvorenie legislatívneho a inštitucionálneho systému v oblasti odpadového hospodárstva s konkrétnym zameraním na odpad z elektrických zariadení. V tomto smere aktivity EPPO a SAŽP adresujú obe priority aktuálnej stratégie (Dobrú správu vecí verejných aj Vodu a sanitáciu).

ADRA Moldova implementuje projekty SlovakAid v spolupráci s ADRA Slovakia už od roku 2009. Ide o projekty v oblasti zlepšenia dostupnosti pitnej vody a kanalizácie pre vidiecke oblasti, so zameraním na vzdelávacie inštitúcie (pitná voda a čistenie odpadovej vody v školách a materských školách).

participating-org.narrative: Ministerstvo zahraničných vecí a európskych záležitostí SR

description.narrative:
MONDAY, 19 March 2018, TUESDAY, 20 March 2018, WEDNESDAY, 21 March 2018, THURSDAY, 22 March 2018

Official opening, organisational aspects

Opening presentations by senior management to set the scene for the entire week
Political leadership

Vision and policy framework for development cooperation

 Overall vison
 Priority issues for global engagements, peace and security, climate change, illicit financial flows
 Commitment to policy coherence including coordination of partners
 Global efforts, on sustainable development and coherence between domestic policies and development objectives
 Vision (purpose of development cooperation, overarching framework for development, alignment with 2030 Agenda)
 Scope (policy framework focused on sustainability)
 Poverty reduction and leaving no-one behind
 Fragility and risks
Lunch hosted by SAMRS

Bilateral discussions with Moldova

 Brief overview of the country strategy/plan and future plans
 Alignment of strategy /plan with the national plan and SDGs
 Quality, volume and focus of official development finance from the reviewed member
 Partnership choices and development effectiveness
Links between country budget and HQ/multilateral funds
